definition: to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity

sentences.english: He leans his arms on the door and brings his face to the window.
sentences.chinese: 他把胳膊枕在车门上，把脸凑近窗户。

sentences.english: As long as you get closer to the nose longans , a faint scent came on smelling.
sentences.chinese: 你只要把鼻子凑近桂圆，一种淡淡的清香就扑鼻而来。

sentences.english: Press photographers get close-ups of the Oscar telecast model.
sentences.chinese: 媒体摄影记者凑近了拍奥斯卡电视直播的舞台模型。

sentences.english: She peered closer. They were little grey things.
sentences.chinese: 她凑近仔细看看，原来是些灰不溜秋的小东西。

sentences.english: Lips to the vessels, never shrink.
sentences.chinese: 让嘴凑近酒器，不要后退。

sentences.english: I liked to lean my forehead on my amp’s speaker enclosure when I played guitar.
sentences.chinese: 当我弹奏吉他的时候，我喜欢把我的额头凑近音箱。

sentences.english: Take a close look at your nails. Are they strong and healthy looking?
sentences.chinese: 凑近看看自己的指甲，看起来是否结实健康？

sentences.english: So let's take a close look at it. It's a circle.
sentences.chinese: 让我们凑近了看，办公室的外观是个圆环。

sentences.english: Look more closely, though, and some of these distinctions become blurred.
sentences.chinese: 然而，凑近了看，某些差异却变得模糊不清。

sentences.english: Mr King held one fish up to his nose and smelt it.
sentences.chinese: 金先生拿起一条，凑近鼻子闻一闻。

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to approach/to get close to/to sneak up on/near to
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
to turn one's head/in no time/in the twinkling of an eye
to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
to come close/to get near to/front
to take a furtive look at
